Wladimir de Lara Araujo Filho

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/4139097592634750
  • Última atualização do currículo em 11/07/2009

Possui graduação em Engenharia de Computação pelo Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (1998) e cursando doutorado em Engenharia de Computação pela Carleton University, em Ottawa, Canadá. Atualmente é gerente de engenharia no Departamento de Parcerias da Juniper Networks em Ottawa, Canadá. Tem experiência na área de Software, com ênfase em Sistemas de Telecomunicações, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: Internet Protocol, serviços em redes IP, sistemas distribuídos, software concorrente, software orientado a objetos, Java, qualidade de software, modelagem de software concorrente. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Formação acadêmica/titulação
2004
Doutorado em andamento em Computer Engineering.
Carleton University, C.U., Canadá.
Título: Assessing the Effectiveness of Design Contracts as Test Oracles in the Detection of Faults in Concurrent Object-Oriented Software,
Orientador: Lionel Claude Briand and Yvan Labiche.
Palavras-chave: Java; Design by Contract; Object-oriented Software; Software Quality; Concurrency.
Grande área: Ciências Exatas e da Terra / Área: Ciência da Computação / Subárea: Metodologia e Técnicas da Computação / Especialidade: Engenharia de Software.

Outras informações relevantes

 
Professional Experience

Juniper Networks, Inc.       Ottawa - ON
Engineering Manager (since July, 2007)
 Supervise the development of features for Juniper s Partner Solutions Development Platform SDK, which is part of Juniper s Partnerships Division.
 Supervise a geographically distributed team with sites in Canada, USA and India.
 Lead and supervise the SDK Developer Support team, which is responsible for supporting strategic partners developing applications on Juniper s devices.
 Lead joint architecture seminars to determine solution feasibility, derive product roadmap and high-level project plans.

Senior Development Engineer (until July, 2007)
 Analysis, design and implementation of object-oriented telecommunication software systems in Java and Python.
 Lead developer of the Workflow component, a high-performance special-purpose workflow management system for telecommunication service provisioning.
 Lead developer of the Service Activation Engine, a service management system that allows the dynamic activation of subscriber specific value-added services on multiple router platforms (edge and core), including coordinated multi-point policy enforcement.
 Leader activities include task effort estimation, prioritization and assignment in conjunction with group manager.
 Expertise on high performance concurrent systems, distributed computing and middleware technology: CORBA, Java RMI, XML messaging, HTTP, TCP/IP.
 Expertise on policy-based routing and related management protocols (COPS, COPS-PR, RADIUS, BEEP, SNMP).
 Experience with directory systems: LDAP, DSML, JNDI.
 Experience with Web-programming technologies and products: Java Servlets, JSP, Apache Tomcat, IBM Websphere Application Server.
 Working knowledge of the IMS architecture standard for next-generation networks, encompassing the SIP, SDP, H.248, and DIAMETER protocols.
 Use
